sentence.text: The aim of this cross-sectional study was to evaluate the functioning and regulation of transcription, DNA-templated-QoL determinants in 67 patients with anti-MAG neuropathy in terms of the International Classification of Functioning, Disability, and Health (ICF).

Although anti-myelin-associated glycoprotein (MAG) antibody neuropathy is reported as a slowly progressive disease, it can lead to significant disability and impairment of health-related quality of life (regulation of transcription, DNA-templated-QoL) and social participation.
